EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0))
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0)) [Refueled in Step 1106; output blockage warning remains]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5))
  • Pickup: (–15.5, –49.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5))
– Iron Chest (output sink) (position: (–13.5, –49.5))
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5))
  • Associated Iron Chest: (–13.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter (position: (–12.5, –49.5)) [Re-placed in Steps 1107–1108; connected via power poles]
– Sink Inserter (position: (–13.5, –45.5))
  • Pickup: (–13.5, –46.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting fast inserter drop (position: (–11.5, –49.5)) to sink inserter pickup (position: (–13.5, –46.5))

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0))
  [Warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5)) [Status: NO_POWER; input inventory: {'automation-science-pack': 23}]
– Offshore Pump (original) (position: (–7.5, 25.5))
– Offshore Pump (new) (position: (–9.5, 24.5))
  [Connected to Boiler for water supply]
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5))
  • Energy: 2000.0; Warnings: [] (refueled in Step 1144)
– Steam Engine (position: (2.5, 27.5))
  • Warnings: ['no input liquid', 'no fluid present in connections']

### Standalone Steam Engine at position (7.5, 23.5)
Use-case: Electricity generation.
Consists of:
– Steam Engine (position: (7.5, 23.5))
  • Energy: 15000.0; Warnings: ['no input liquid', 'no fluid present in connections']
– Connected Neighbours:
  • Pipes at positions (5.5, 20.5), (6.5, 20.5), (7.5, 20.5), (8.5, 20.5)
  • Small Electric Pole (position: (7.5, 26.5))
Note: Multiple manual pipeline bridging attempts aimed at connecting this engine to the Boiler (at (2.0, 17.5)) have failed, resulting in persistent fluid connection warnings.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5)) [Warning: not receiving electricity; missing resource: iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity Network via Small Electric Poles (e.g., at (3.5, –1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), …)

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple PipeGroups distributed across the map (e.g., positions (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), etc.)
– A working PipeGroup linking the Offshore Pump (new) (position: (–9.5, 24.5)) to the Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5))
– A PipeGroup connecting the Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5)) to the Lab Power Integration System’s Steam Engine (position: (2.5, 27.5))
Note: Manual pipeline bridging attempts between the Boiler and the Standalone Steam Engine were not successful.

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and integration of mined resources.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking the Burner Mining Drill’s fast inserter drop (position: (–11.5, –49.5)) to the Sink Inserter pickup (position: (–13.5, –46.5))
– Electricity Network formed by Small Electric Poles:
  • Pole (position: (–12.5, –48.5))
  • Additional Pole (position: (–10.5, –49.5)) [placed in Step 1104]
  • Pole (position: (–12.5, –50.5)) connected with the re-placed fast inserter
  • New power pole (position: (2.5, 30.5)) connected to the Lab Power Integration System’s Steam Engine

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Boiler Fueling and Fluid Connection Consistency
  – Maintain a continuous fuel supply for the Boiler to ensure stable energy levels.
  – Although refueled successfully, ensure that fluid connection points remain unobstructed when attempting manual pipeline bridging.

• Entity Placement and Collision
  – Repeated pipe placement failures indicate that target tiles are occupied or the terrain prohibits placement.
  – Confirm that the designated coordinates for pipe entities are free from obstacles and support placement before execution.

• Manual Pipeline Chain Incompleteness
  – Multiple attempts to bridge the fluid gap between the Boiler (at (2.0, 17.5)) and the Standalone Steam Engine (at (7.5, 23.5)) have resulted in incomplete chains.
  – Reassess and adjust the placement strategy or consider automated routing to reliably secure fluid connectivity.

• Fine-Grained Pipeline Placement Difficulties
  – Incremental adjustments with alternative offsets consistently failed to yield a complete manual pipeline chain.
  – Review the offset calculations and ensure that fine-grained positional adjustments do not lead to collisions with existing entities or unbuildable terrain.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.
   • Success: Returns the located entity.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if not found.
• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.
• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.
• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.
• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection.
• place_entity_next_to(entity_type: Any, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Any  
  – Attempts to place an entity adjacent to the reference position.
   • Success: Entity is correctly placed.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if a collision is detected.
• place_entity(entity_type: Any, direction: Direction, position: Position) -> Any  
  – Places an entity at the specified position in the given direction.
   • Success: Entity is placed when within the allowed range.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if the target position exceeds the maximum placement distance.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Expected location for the repositioned Steam Engine at (2.5, 27.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
